page.title: 07Sea Defences
page.content: The Suffolk Coastal District Council spends 20-30 thousand pounds a year on sea defences. A new wall has been built along the Felixstowe coast from the ferry. The Anglian Water Board is finis hing building this. Heavy machines, cra nes and dumpers are extending it to Lan dgaurd point. This Landguard scheme will have cost 880,000 pounds by the end of 1985 and 550m of sea wall will have been built. The wall design is att ractive but was not built with tourism in mind. Since the big floods of 1953, when the Orwell river flooded our area the new freighter terminals at the dock have been built above the old sea wall level and so make a type of sea defence The most vulnerable place is the Land- guard end of Felixstowe. In emergencies the police set off sirens and may evac- uate people. Pupils from Langer School were last evacuated in 1977.
